intro: Canthium dunnianum, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands. Canthium dunnianum is also known for its latex-like sap, which can be toxic to livestock.
